title: Eurobtcservices
author: Eurobtcservices
content: I sell private keys to BTC wallets. Nothing else. Come get your private keys here. PayPal and Western Union buys are scams! I only do BTC wallets. Will accept a â‚¬5 purchase first time to prove legitimacy. Afterwards, we work with no less than â‚¬250 at a time. Email me at eurobtcservices@dnmx.org so we can start doing business today. Don't fall for another scam again! Thank you for your time. Good day!

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: ScamOr trolling.Anyone can download a reputed wallet, generate seed phrase, keys (private keys and public keys) and addresses.So you want to sell what is free.

comments.author: Eurobtcservices
comments.body: No it is a legit service just try us and see! DM me or email for more info! ðŸ˜Š

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: You really want to sells these kind of stuff here?Dummy, as if like people here are ignorant of such things where almost everyone here knows what and where private keys and seeds are and can get.Nice try btw.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: 100% scam. You are hoping someone uses your service, loads 1btc+ and you take it from them since you have their priv keys. Anyone with half a brain would hopefully see right through this attempt at scamming.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: Eurobtcservices on July 26, 2022, 07:07:00 PMNo it is a legit service just try us and see! DM me or email for more info! ðŸ˜ŠThis is the dumbest post I've seen in my tenure here in Bitcoin, selling something free and useless, there's a chance that if you will sell your underwear for 5 cents there'll be a buyer than selling a wallet and its private key Â   buddy it's not April Fool's day stop drinking too much you'll gonna get screwed.

comments.body: I dont know if It Is Just fun proposal or One of the stupide scam I have seen in bitcointalk.Please note you are not saying to destroy Key generated nor the protocol you are using ... I mean there Is not any reason to trust something like this What you mean exactly for legitimacy of your service ?!Quote from: Eurobtcservices on July 26, 2022, 06:56:17 PM I sell private keys to BTC wallets. Nothing else. Come get your private keys here. PayPal and Western Union buys are scams! I only do BTC wallets. Will accept a â‚¬5 purchase first time to prove legitimacy. Good day!

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on July 27, 2022, 09:29:16 AMI dont know if It Is Just fun proposal or One of the stupide scam I have seen in bitcointalk.Please note you are not saying to destroy Key generated nor the protocol you are using ... I mean there Is not any reason to trust something like this It is the dumbest and I'm surprised that of all the platforms he'll do this here in Bitcointalk, where people are taught that not your key, not your coin, and never share your private key to anyone, he is insulting all of us here and I'll go berserk if someone here takes what he is offering Quote from: Eurobtcservices on July 26, 2022, 06:56:17 PM I sell private keys to BTC wallets. Nothing else. Come get your private keys here. PayPal and Western Union buys are scams! I only do BTC wallets. Will accept a â‚¬5 purchase first time to prove legitimacy. Afterwards, we work with no less than â‚¬250 at a time. Email me at eurobtcservices@dnmx.org so we can start doing business today. Don't fall for another scam again! Thank you for your time. Good day!I'm waiting for OP to post that he is joking and just trying to see if someone will take his bait, but unfortunately for him, he already got a red tag before he can do that.

comments.author: mocacinno
comments.body: Quote from: Eurobtcservices on July 26, 2022, 06:56:17 PM--snip-- Don't fall for another scams again, instead fall for mine! --snipFixed that for you...All kidding aside, there are no legitimate usecases for such a service. If you're selling freshly generated keys or seeds, you are charging for something anybody (and their mothers) can do for free. If you're selling keys or seeds for funded wallets you're most likely a scammer, and in the (astronomically small) chance you're not scamming your buyers, you're helping them commit fraud (but the odds of not scamming your buyers are astronomically small)

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: Eurobtcservices on July 26, 2022, 06:56:17 PM I sell private keys to BTC wallets. Nothing else. Come get your private keys here. PayPal and Western Union buys are scams! I only do BTC wallets. Will accept a â‚¬5 purchase first time to prove legitimacy. Afterwards, we work with no less than â‚¬250 at a time. Email me at eurobtcservices@dnmx.org so we can start doing business today. Don't fall for another scam again! Thank you for your time. Good day!There is no use to buy private key of the wallets if there are no bitcoins in it. I hope you are selling private keys which store many bitcoinsÂ  Why not tell us the wallet addresses so that we can choose firstÂ   I would suggest you that stop fooling people because people at bitcointalk won't fall for such baby scams.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Troll + SCAM. Are there these kinds of stupid around the forum who will buy a private key? Do you know what does mean private key? It's not purchasable nor transferable assets. Anyone can generate a private key and secure funds. OP trying to make you fool guys. Don't follow him, you will lose your funds. There is no reason to buy a private key anyway.

comments.author: suchmoon
comments.body: Half price is way too expensive. Bitcoin is on sale right now at ~70% off.That, and of course the OP is a scamtroll.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: Hahaha, that bullshit is clearly a scam. I hope you will never get a single customer interested in doing this. But somehow the mod doesn't lock this thread and throws it in the trash as the OP's attempt is a clear scam. Is this still relevant enough not to moderate the scam?

comments.author: Eurobtcservices
comments.body: Selling hacked wallets that haven't been accessed in over a year. They have BTC in them. Just a way to wash my money and we both help eachother out at the same time. If you don't want to try it, then that's fine. Just putting it out here in case someone is interested. You can test this service for â‚¬5 in BTC for a â‚¬10 private key if you are interested. If someone tries it, they can tell the rest of these haters it's legit. Not exactly legal, but still not a scam on my end. I do legitimate business. Good day.

comments.author: suchmoon
comments.body: Quote from: Eurobtcservices on July 27, 2022, 07:21:43 PMa way to wash my moneyFor a 50% "fee"? LOLYou're gonna have a hard time finding a moron who is not familiar with Nigerian scams.

Just a way to wash my money and we both help each other out at the same time. this is just a way to lure people into falling into your trapQuoteIf you don't want to try it, then that's fine. Not fine with us scammers like you don't have a place here in BitcointalkQuoteJust putting it out here in case someone is interested. You can test this service for â‚¬5 in BTC for a â‚¬10 private key if you are interested. If someone tries it, they can tell the rest of these haters it's legit. Not exactly legal, but still not a scam on my end. I do legitimate business. Good day.You cannot prove that you're not a scammer because scam is written all over on what you're offering.

comments.author: sbrys
comments.body: I fully agree this sounds like a scam however some new investors could need some help with their first steps. Itâ€™s a big step for a newbie to generate a new key and send funds to it. Hence also why so many people just keep their investments on an exchangeâ€¦But ok again this is not the way

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Quote from: sbrys on July 28, 2022, 01:19:18 PMI fully agree this sounds like a scam however some new investors could need some help with their first steps. Thats why we have the forum, to help them. This here is just ridiculous.

comments.author: noormcs5
comments.body: Quote from: sbrys on July 28, 2022, 01:19:18 PMI fully agree this sounds like a scam however some new investors could need some help with their first steps. Itâ€™s a big step for a newbie to generate a new key and send funds to it. Hence also why so many people just keep their investments on an exchangeâ€¦But ok again this is not the wayÂ  Anyone who is a newbie should also keep the funds in the private wallet and not in the exchanges but they should generate the private key themselves and not let other people do this task for them.Services like these will only scam newbies and those who do not know how bitcoin works. That's why its always recommended to first learn and then invest in crypto.

comments.author: sbrys
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on July 29, 2022, 09:04:09 PMQuote from: sbrys on July 28, 2022, 01:19:18 PMI fully agree this sounds like a scam however some new investors could need some help with their first steps. Itâ€™s a big step for a newbie to generate a new key and send funds to it. Hence also why so many people just keep their investments on an exchangeâ€¦But ok again this is not the wayÂ  Anyone who is a newbie should also keep the funds in the private wallet and not in the exchanges but they should generate the private key themselves and not let other people do this task for them.Services like these will only scam newbies and those who do not know how bitcoin works. That's why its always recommended to first learn and then invest in crypto.Even with some homework it's a big step to create a private key and send funds to it. It's kinda counter-intuitive with what you learned before.I have created tons of private keys for friends during their first steps. It works because they trust me but imagine having to scroll the internet and do this in isolation the first time
